best lightmeter app

Im having trouble trying to read the f-stop and shutter speed reading on this meter. Are the mesures lined up the top middle? I couldnt find any info on how to read the meter on the app either. The app looks good, hoping to understand it better (I'm sure its simple enough to read, just not straight forward if you not familiar with that model of camera). Thanks in advance.
Awesome. Accurate, easy to use one handed and abilty to zoom in is really ussful.
This app is amazing! It is completely worth the $2. I use this as a primary light meter and carry a backup analog one.
Brilliant! Looks & feels good. Incident, reflected, spot. Easy to calibrate. Real quality - well worth the small charge (don’t waste your time trying to find a free one in this league!)

I gave the paid version and it's great on my s7. I "spot meter" by running around the scene but the readings allow me to calculate the best exposure!

Easily the best light meter app I have found. I've tested it against professional meters on multiple phones. It is always dead accurate. If for some reason it is not, it even has the ability to calibrate your readings! Easily worth buying if you do photography with manual cameras. It's a wonderful bit of my kit that has never failed me!
After paying for the app I tried installing it more than 5x It just wont install, with data and wifi

Excellent! Nice to have meter with an intuitive, analog readout. I love the simple calculator dial of my Weston 737, and this works just as well. Unfortunately the settings tab is placed where I can't get to it: if I try to touch it, phone settings come down instead of app settings. I would LOVE to see continuous reading in reflected mode. Perhaps this is a little ambitious, but that would make this my favorite metering app by a huge margin.

Love it

Despite me giving this a 2 star, I will use it. It crashes the audio driver on my phone a few times, pausing podcasts and music (I really can't screenshot the audio, so, to hell with that). I had to restart the phone, and this and that. The audio when taking meter is unmutable, the viewfinder's image looks squished—little things. The UI is great, but the settings tray thingy is kinda trash. I love this app, don't get me wrong, but a tweak like muting the app would solve a lotta problems.

Installed in OnePlus 7. The app works almost perfect when used indoors in reflective mode. In sunny condition, the readings are wrong. The values remain constant no matter where I point the phone. Hope this bug is sorted out in future update.

I used an old Weston V analog light meter for my film work as well as a newer Sekonic Digital Light meter And honestly this app works just as well 98% of the time. When shooting color negative film the results have always been very pleasing and exactly what I was going for depending on my metering needs. I surely hope that this product continues to develop and will someday have the features that the iOS version has.

Great fun interface and works great. The haptic feedback after metering is a nice touch also. Developers seem to maintain the all really well too.
Amazing app. I use it to mesure for medium format and 35mm film cameras. Works as well as my dedicated meters.

Very handy app otherwise, very useful for those tricky lighting that you can't use Sunny 16 on.

Great app. Reflective readings work very well on Samsung S8. Added a Luxi for All dome for incident readings. Used the calibration option to get the readings corrected. Very handy app.
Great

Точность проверял на зеркальной камере но мерить следует аккуратно, по усреднённой  области. Как говориться, для всех экспонометров все кошки серы. И это приложение позволяет через камеру телефона видеть что измеряешь. Ещё не мало важно, что показано изображение в ч/б тонах. Рекомендую. Мой респект создателю.

Had the free version. Used it for so long that I though I ought to give the creators money. Paid version is a good upgrade, iso and metering mode stay the same as you left them which is good. Perfect paring for my Olympus OM1n when I go out on the streets
Excellent and accurate

The meter is very accurate according to my hand held meter. I only have one fault..the numbers are tiny. I carry a small magnifying glass just to be sure I am seeing the correct reading. I just wish there was a way to make the numbers larger to see comfortably.

I quite like this app, very useful. It would be great addition to have 
option expand f stops to f/64
Simple effective and handy tool
i keep various meters in my bags, but this app is always with me, and gets used a lot more than originally intended.. it works well.. it's accurate.. and it looks good, too!

speed relationships.
Great accurate app

Great app, definitely can advise for film fans,have used it for a long time 
on my samsung note 4 with high accuracy of readings,but recently have moved 
to oneplus 6 phone and cant get any reasonable readings using this app. 
Kindly ask developers to add oneplus 6 phone support to this app. Will 
appreciate your work a lot.

This is an excellent implementation of a photographic light meter. I like 
the Apple vesion a little more though I paid for both because they're both 
so we'll done. This is a great tool for those of us who still shoot film on 
classic mechanical cameras.

There is a lot to like about this light meter, especially the style, operation and choice of reflected or incident light meter. If I have one issue, it's that the scales are very difficult to read on bright days. Some sort of high-visibility mode would be a big help.   An update five years on (2018). I can't read the scales without reading glasses, which I don't wear for photography. A mode with large digits would be a great help.
Bang on accuracy, highly recommended 👍

Does what it says, and has an attractive retro interface. However, some 
usability issues - the app shows you the screen for how to use it only 
once, the first time you open it. Tapping anywhere on the screen dismisses 
it forever, can't find any obvious way to get it to reappear. Luckily most 
of the functions are easy enough to figure out. Also has a weird audio bug; 
when using the app with Bluetooth headphones attached, taking a light 
measurement momentarily mutes the headphones, then unmutes them with 
maximum volume, very inconvenient/frustrating (and painfully loud depending 
on your headset).

Fantastic app. I use manual lenses and this is going to save me so much 
time. It appears to be very accurate, hence my buying it. I am quite 
impressed
it works

Works exactly as advertised and worth every cent. Anyone complaining about 
the free version needs to cough up two bucks for the pro version.

Started with the free version and liked it. Upgraded to the full version 
and LOVE it! Full version allows user to calibrate the meter for your 
device (highly recommended! my Galaxy S8 needed a -1.66 stop adjustment) 
and the app saves all settings between uses. This app has almost completely 
replaced my Sekonic L-308.
even make my smart phone smarter!
Its working.  Good joob developer,  can i make a suggestion? 😁  I hope sooner or later u can make an aperture priority mode or shutter speed priority mode. It will be perfect. Thanks to u guys
It's using my front facing camera....
Works OK, but I'd love an option to switch between 1/3 stop and 1/2 stop intervals. Also, times shorter than 1 second should be coloured differently to avoid confusion.
I bought the paid version. Works accurate with my Xiaomi Mi5 after I calibrated it with my Nikon F100. I think it would be nice feature to add if the 'zoom function' represent a lens focal length.

Tried the free version and it worked very well. I liked it so much I bought the paid version. This works well with my Samsung J3 phone in reflected mode. For incident, I meter off of the palm of my hand and increase exposure 1 stop.

This app is worth far more than the 199 pennies I paid for it. After having just switched back to film photography with the discovery of an old Minolta Autocord in my in-laws basement, I had to relearn how to take photographs without a TTL meter (I've been spoiled by DSLRs for 10+ years now). And with each frame of 6x6 film costing me roughly $1 after developing costs, I have an incentive to nail the exposure on the first try!   This app, installed on my Samsung Galaxy S6, gives me nearly identical readings to what the spot and center weighed meter settings in my Nikon D700 gives me. If you've already shelled out a few hundred dollars on a cutting edge smartphone, I think you can safely use it with this app to replace a dedicated handheld meter.   However, there are two caveats to that:  1. This app wasn't designed for flash metering. If you want to meter your flash output, you'll still need a dedicated meter (David Quiles, hint hint, if you could figure out a way to make this app meter flash output accurately, I'd HAPPILY pay another $10 for this app) 2. I've noticed the incident meter changes values depending on the angle at which I hold the front of my phone to the light source. I'm not sure if this app uses the front camera, or rather the light sensor that my phone uses to automatically adjust screen brightness, so this could be a hardware issue on my phone rather than an issue with the app. But in any case, it seems that you need to be thoughtful about the direction you hold your phone when taking an incident meter reading. I'm wondering if one of those clip on white domes for my phone's front camera would improve this?   All in all, I love this app. My 120 roll film is coming out perfectly exposed using this app to meter one my old  Minolta Autocord.
Works just like a real light meter.  I love it. I don't have to carry my Sekonic around anymore.  Now I can just use my phone. What a convenience!
Well, I hope it works. But it came with no instructions. But I can Google.
Works well except, on my lg stylo the, Incident meter doesnt function
Grear app, use it with my bronica etrs all the time, any chance of a sliding iso scale so that i can shoot at 300 iso or other numbers that im not able to use
I use this on a Huawei P9 and get excellent results both on incident and reflected readings. This really helps me nail the exposure on my ancient TLR. Good stuff

Good emulator though needs extra sensitivity to make a reading in low-light situations below   3.5 EV for the reflective-mode (perhaps another mode for this).This will prove very useful for indoor no-flash and outdoor night photography.In spite of this shortcoming the app succeeds to be accurate and fast-responding.Developer,please use different color-coding for slow speeds(1 sec and longer) in the paid-version as well,as shown in one of the app's descriptive pictures.
With a Nexus 6P, it's deadly accurate – that's all that matters. My Canon A-1 and Olympus 35 SP's meters seem to agree.
Free version works great but bought the paid app to get 'sticky' ISO.  Reflected light function works fine on Jiayu S3, haven't figured out the incident readings yet.
One of the best light meter app out there, good accuracy on Galaxy A7 (already compared with Sekonic)

Great light meter. It's quite accurate on my Galaxy S6 and I like the retro style of it. It's great to build your skill, I often walk around guesstimating exposure by eye and experience and use this to see how close I was.
Wonderful and accurate enough for my needs. I never saw any adds in free version but purchased to support author. Thank you!
Terrific App.  Good old fashioned light metering that looks to be pretty accurate.  Very useful for studio work.
Simple light meter that works right next to my Pentax

Shot hundreds of photos with this app, with perfect measurements everytime across several phones.   Only request would be that different scales be added, I use some older cameras that don't use the standard speeds (25, 50, 100... instead of 30, 60, 125...), so I have to do some guess work.  Overall though great app.

Awesome app that I use often. Couple features I would like to see: ISO 1.6 (because of those super-slow motion picture films that are currently popular on eBay). Also would be cool to have support for ND-filters/exposure compensation so that we don't have to calculate things manually (when we shoot low-iso films with ND-filters). Thanks!
Just beautiful to use, not quite accurate but then again, my phone it's not top of the line
Perfect
Works, no fuss.
Great app. Please add more film  profiles, thxs.

Does what it says- turns your phone into an accurate light meter. If you are interested in photography, buy the app and learn how to use it. Your pictures will get better the more you understand how light works!
Great accuracy

Been a fan of the free version for a while, now....wanted to comment/request for a feature "remember ISO and meter mode" which bothered me....and found out the paid version has that.  Totally worth the 2€ upgrade from the free version. Both are pretty accurate, do what they say on the tin.  Highly recommended!

Wonderful for us old geezers who remember meters that look like this. Accurate measurements next to Gossen Mastersix. Zoom feature is handy, an almost spot meter. Those who complain about setting not being saved, do yourselves and the creator a favour and spend three bucks on a useful app: full version saves all settings.
Reflected metering image is upside-down on the a Nexus 5x
Using this app I am learning how to use the manual settings on my Nikon to take pictures without a flash. Loving it.
Love it, thanks! Don't know if my phone sensors would even be capable, but I welcome higher ISO sensitivity.
Well done. paid version allows +/- 4 stop adjustments in 1/3 stops.
fantastic for using with a film camera
As an exposure meter - obviously depends on camera in phone - can be as accurate as a handheld actual meter. With my Lenovo K50 it's excellent. I paid the small support sum to help encourage author.

Great app. Works well with my Motorola Zboard. Worth the mere price of admission for the no add version. Please add ISO 6400.  Update, this is by far the best light meter app I have tried. ISO 6400 has been added. When comparing readings against my Sekonic L308S-U light meter, the results are spot on using my Galaxy Note 5.

Beautiful, simple design. App only takes up 12 MB when installed. And best of all, it works! Checked readings with my Nikon D40x DSLR and perfect match!  Phone: Sony Xperia Z3 Compact (D5803) Modes: Both incident and reflected worked accurately Happy to support the developer by buying paid version!
Calibrated perfectly on a Samsung S6 using a Fujifilm X70 as reference.  It holds readings and has a great interface.
A great app for those of us who still use film - occasionally!
Love this app. Shot a whole roll of film on an old olympus camera using only this app for metering and the pictures came out great.
Wow so worth the 3 dollars.. Most useful on the go app!

I had this on my Galaxy 4 Mini and now on my Galaxy 7 Edge.  This app is a lifesaver for us analog shooters.  I have a couple of cameras that don''t have built-in meters. And although my Sekonic L398 is a good meter, I don't feel like lugging it around-especially with night photography.  LightMeter has an excellent film speed range-especially for those of us who like to push/pull their film speeds.  Plus, its f-stop and shutter speed range covers the gamut of most shooting situations.  And if you're blessed to have a phone with a good battery life, you can use this with very little concern.  Great app for any analog photographer.
It's worth the gamble! I use this for cameras without a light meter and when Sunny 16 is tricky. Easy to read and a little over half the shots meters with this app turn out perfectly.
Nice app, but I feel dizzy how to look the result? There is no menu in app? Could you help me?

I compared the incident reading if this app (installed on Samsung Galaxy S7) to my Sekonic L-478-U and it matched. This is a very accurate light meter to use when you need one and don't have the budget to buy an actual light meter. Of course it has limitations with very dimly lit environment but sufficient for most cases. I have not tested it on other smart phones but I can attest it was acuurate with my SG7 and it's built-in sensors.
As accurate as my Pentax Spotmeter V. Amazing performance. Worth every penny.

Have used this for a long time now. Well worth the outlay. Has proved invaluable even on pro jobs when caught out re batteries for my spot meter. To the point where I nearly got rid of the dedicated meter.    ****Feature request**** Zone system markings please! Like my old Gossen Lunasix F. The zone system still has a place in the digital world. ;) I'd give you six stars then!

It works like a dream. Plus there is the added bonus of one less piece of kit to carry around. Had the free version which was brilliant, but the paid version has settings so you can calibrate it which makes it a must have for any photographer.
If you're in the need for a good light meter and don't have your money up yet for it this is the perfect solution until than.

Tested with my build in nikon d5100 meter and I assumed that with my phone turning reflected light down 1,67 stop meter just as accurate as nikon meter well done! Using a meizu m1 note

I'm always skeptical, but with this app.. Wow!!..I left my light meter at home and decided to download this.. Holy beans!..it works like a charm, every exposition is spot on!.. Perfect!

I just got my first DSLR camera for my college photography class, this meter was easy to figure out and has helped me loads in class.

Works great

Started with lite and couldn't pass up not having the full version. Well worth the price and a perfect companion that I don't have to carry in my camera bag since my phone is in my pocket anyway.

I use this with my Nikon F film camera. I compare it to my Olympus OM2 built in light meter, which is accurate and produces brilliant film photos. This app has been spot on every time. I recently paid for this app to show my appreciation and get a few more features.
I am a 35 mm film photog and I use this app on an unused smartphone as my dedicated light meter. Very happy with it!
Wonderful app! If the dev added an IR or full spectrum mode (IR+visible) it was be flawless!
Nexus 9, 6.0 is not working. Please fix and I will buy it again.

I use it on a Z3 & ran some tests with my Xpro1, exposure is spot on with the spot meter! My GW690II is on its way & this app will help a lot. I basically saved a couple of hundred euros for a spot/zoom meter. Thanks for that dev. Just add an easier/faster to read skin (LCD or similar) & it's 5 stars!
What more do you need?
The best meter I've found so far.  Just one suggestion, PLEASE add a feature that allows locking the ISO.  Right now it's too easy to change it without noticing.

You can calibrate this meter for the peculiarities of your cameras and lenses. If you're new to external metering, watch a Web video for tips on how to use a handheld meter. I like to play with this when I'm out and about to test the exposure of scenes I may want to return to with my camera.

I had free version and i was complaining about why it doesn't recall last used ISO settings...  DIdn't realize i had free version since i don't see any ads anyway :)  This is definetely worth every penny if you are B&W film photographer!
for my needs, this light meter does exactly what I need it to do.  I've tried others, but decided to spend 2 bucks to get the full version of this app and so far it's worth every penny. thanks!

It's honestly a lot more accurate then I would have expected. The dev more than deserves what he is charging. Spot is quite good and incident ain't half bad considering the sensor is flat. It at least gives you a good idea of light required.

An essential companion whenever I am using film camera without built in meter. I wish someone made an app where my phone can work as a viewfinder. Together it would make analogue photography so much convenient.
Have this on my tablet and phone. Very consistent results.

Not entirely sure how light meters compare against each other in DSLRs, but when I match the zoom on both for reflected (my primary use for a light meter), this app is either spot on or pretty darn near. The camera compared against was a Canon 7D and the phone is an LG G4. Frankly, I had the free version for a while as a play thing since I rely on my 7D to do this kind of thing. But I've a Leica IIIF in the mail, so suddenly taking this app more seriously! 😆
I've used this to shoot both B&W and color negative films, and have got consistent results!! Bought app to support dev - thanks David!!
Awesomely useful.
Great backup to my sunny 16 training. I use it w Leica M4-2. Readings have been spot on viz test readings on my Nikon mirrorless. Xperia Z.
I absolutely love this app... Its bang on.. I just wish you had a digital option .!!
Example of skeuomorphic design done perfectly. Works well.
Accurate incident and reflective meter. Easy to use s3.

After cross-checking against an old digital point and shoot, and the selenium meter on a film camera (not the most reliable things to check against, but I'm travelling and my meter is at home. Whoops!), a reflected calibration of -1.67 EV is needed on my device. Once altered, the meter is near enough correct in most lighting situations.  I haven't calibrated the incident meter yet, as I've not had anything to check that against. If I calibrate that, I'll share the results.
I've tried this app in a number of tricky situations and it has been accurate. The no-ads version is great.

Just like the real thing but better. Recently I forgot my Weston 9 at home and needed a meter. I downloaded this app and I was off and running. Shooting Fuji Across 100 through my old Contax II, all 36 exposures came out correctly exposed. This app does exactly what it is supposed to do, nothing more nothing less. All apps should be like this.
Just perfect.

Amazing app. Readings might 1 stop lower than camera accuracy, but once you get it, it saves lots of money on buying an lighy meter. I am going for the paid version as a thank you for all the efforts put through it!
Everything is good, but runs very slow on my lg g3, not even useble, i will change to 5 stars when this fixed.
Well..it works...can't get better than that. .nice
A must have for all kind of photographers!!

Very easy to use, and in reflected metering, it's also pretty accurate. The default incident metering is significantly less accurate, though it gets better the longer you leave it to meter. Give the free version a try, and if your phone camera supports reflected metering, the pro version is well worth the purchase.
Both metering methods match my Sekonic L-758.
Lagging on HTC one m8
Great Backup

I side-loaded it using Snap with no issues ((BB OS 10.2.1)..Everything works, including the Incident/Reflected switch and the zoom lever for reflected readings.  I casually tested the free version against an old Sekonic incident light meter and found the readings were close enough for me (within a half a stop) so I went with the paid version. I rely on in-camera metering to nail exposure but the external meter is very nice to have when I don't have my camera but encounter possible locations and wonder "what settings would I need to shoot in here?" Love the retro design
이거는 뭐.... 너무 맴에 드넹~.... 꽁짜 앱을 써보니 너무 좋은 앱이라서 개발자에게 소다 한 병 못사주겠습니까? 소다 한 잔 값으로 정품 구매합니당.
Amazingly accurate!

I got it to use to set my exposure on shots & with my SG4 it works fine. I bought the paid version purely to support the developer. In reality I'd pay a lot more if a couple of things where added. 1. The ability to measure flash, i.e. a mode for the app to wait for a flash to be fired & capture the results. 2. Display the flash %, i.e. the % of light the flash adds. 3. Better calibration settings would make it nearly as good as any dedicated meter. 4. Pcsync to send ttl through an audio cable to a flash. :)
More than worth the money. Very well done.
Well, with a new meter at £140+, £90 to refurb a Weston Master V, what else can I say?
Well worth the money, thank you for a truly useful application, David.
Seems to work fine with HTC One (M7)

I've never really understood the correlation between all the needed numbers . I think the layout made them finally click for me.  I liked using it SO much I purchased after just 1 day using  the free app.  Thx David!
It says it's 12 MBs but once installed, it's 40.55 MBs. Other meter apps are around 500 KBs. Why the enormous footprint? The free version was 12. Please make it smaller.
Awesome app.
We done
Nice for checking wide lighting when out and about.
Excellent app
A must have in full non automation mode.
Very very handy for my old Hassy. Just use your head where to meter and you're golden. Love the interface.

I shoot with a d800 and this app  matches its meter right on.  A hold setting would be nice. The glitch is on the reflective preview window. It visually tweaks out a bit when I hit measure button.  Other than that the function and accuracy are top notch.  Very attractive and useful app.

Really love this meter.  Using it for my Hasselblad 500c and Rolleiflex with great accuracy.  I had researched many apps and many physical meters, but this one blows all the apps away and is much more convenient than a physical meter (as my phone never leaves my side).  Nice clean readout.
Works perfectly if you know how to read a scene properly. I use this in spot 99% of the time and it's breathed new life into a lot of my old cameras. Thank you.

I've tried several light meter apps and this is the best one I've found.  Accurate (compared to Minolta meter) and good intuitive interface. I like the way you can see exactly what you are measuring in reflective mode. Top stuff!
the spot metering through the camera works very well, and I love the zoom option. all in all, a reliable light meter for under 3$ is very hard to beat.

Thus a huge app. 43 MB just for a little measuring of light. There are whole office suites with this size. Please reduce the size. IMHO something like 5MB would be appropriate. Otherwise the app works fine.
A very accurate and useful tool.
Unknown error code "0"...

Ok in reflected mode but leaves the phone in mute. If I turn off sound management solved this but now makes annoying camera sound when I take a reading. Incident reading (which is what I really wanted) doesn't work at all.
replyContent:
support email is davidquiles@me.com
free and fast.

content: First of all this app is simply beautifully designed. It's intuitive and easy to read. Skeumorphism is not dead yet. :-)   Secondly the author of the app responded to a bug report and made a new version to fix it within 24 hours... And that was over the weekend!    Good app with good support. What more can you ask for? :-)
Works like a dream. Only needed a slight calibration.
Like having my Gossen along, without the extra bulk. Worth the $2.49 for the pro version.

1) The UI lags significantly on the HTC One, which is a pretty fast phone.   2) Metering reflected simply uses the camera built-in AE and uses that as a meter display. Better approach would be to grab the EXIF and the image data, assume 18% grey world and compute lux. As it is right now it is somewhat susceptible to various device specific AE weirdness

Everything is great, one problem: sometimes the measure button works and sometimes the only way to activate the reflected meter is to press my volume button? Not sure if this is something anyone else has come across. 5 stars if that was solved.   Other than that its great. Saved ISO is more than worth the $2.
My only wish is that this app could do a better job detecting flash. It does everything else perfect though

Old school photographer, tested this app against my trusted Sekonic and Gossen meters and the app matched the readings. Like the simple layout, not used for mobile "camera" (why would anyone do that?), used for manual film camera exposures. Only software so still pack a real meter but trust the app, it works. Put your price up, it's worth it!

I am using this on a Samsung Galaxy Note 2.  I really appreciate the design and operation of this app.  I would like to suggest a few possible improvements.  First, when you press MEASURE the app displays the aperture, shutter speed and ISO of the test shot.  At least on the Samsung Galaxy Note 2, I think this test shot is indicative of the exposure to expect from the camera when taking an actual photo.  For that reason, it would be valuable if the aperture, shutter speed and ISO value was displayed persistently instead of in a pop-up window (this operation could be a setting).  In addition, it would be helpful to have a setting that would allow the ISO value from this test shot to become the ISO value setting on the meter.  Another setting to highlight both the test shot aperture and shutter speed on the meter scale (possibly as a red and green line or dot).  A phone like the Samsung Galaxy Note 2 seems to always use an aperture of 2.6.  The little red or green dots would immediately show likely results. Another request, in the MEASURE pop-up display shutter speed in the format like 1/15 or 1/125 instead of the decimal value currently displayed.  Thanks for the app.
Great job
Decided to get the no ad version and it did not disappoint. Readings are very accurate. But why the vibrate when exiting the program? It's annoying!
Compared readings from this app against my Extech dedicated light meter and it is spot on with my Droid RAZR Maxx! Strongly recommend!
Many Thanks.  Have been looking for a decent light meter. Surprisingly accurate Zoom, function is wicked! Many Many Thanks :)
Very useful and usable tool for cinema and photography. In samsung s3 doesn't work the incident meter (or at least i can't make it work properly) but the reflected does all the magic...
A very accurate and easy to use app. A must for those with vintage or LOMO cameras. The free version is great, but this version gets rid of the annoying ads and gives the app more screen room.
